item.title: What Happened to Europe’s Terrorism Problem?
item.description: Not that long ago, big attacks were a daily concern. We look at why it feels different now.

item.title: Alberta Invokes Last-Resort Constitutional Clause to Shield Trans Laws From Challenges
item.description: The western province’s conservative government has invoked a rarely used clause in Canada’s Constitution to shield its bills limiting transgender righ...

item.title: Henry Todd, LSD Kingpin Turned Everest Guide, Dies at 80
item.description: He helped make and distribute millions of LSD tablets in the 1970s. After seven years in prison, he ran mountain climbing expeditions in the Himalayas...

item.title: Israeli Strikes Kill at Least 25 in Gaza Amid Cease-Fire, Officials Say
item.description: Israel’s military said it had launched attacks across Gaza after Palestinian militants shot at its troops. The six-week-old cease-fire has been pierce...

item.title: Old Divides of East and West Haunt Germany’s Newest Arrivals
item.description: Refugees who poured into the country a decade ago fared better when they landed in the more prosperous West, an enduring legacy of reunification.
